summary: Comprehensive testing of GuessIt football prediction platform. Backend APIs 90% functional (9/10 tests passed). Frontend UI 85% functional with key authentication state persistence issue. Homepage, login/register pages, and core features working correctly.

minor_issues.issue: WebSocket endpoint returns 404 on HTTP GET request
minor_issues.impact: Minor - WebSocket connections are actually working based on logs

integration_issues.issue: User authentication state not persisted after successful registration and nickname setting - user appears logged out on homepage
Protected routes like /my-predictions redirect to login page even after successful registration

passed_tests: Backend: API root endpoint returns 'GuessIt API is running'
Backend: Health check endpoint working
Backend: Football matches API returns 122+ matches (requirement: 100+)
Backend: Live matches API functional
Backend: Competitions API functional
Backend: User registration API working with proper validation
Backend: Nickname setting API functional
Backend: Auth/me endpoint working
Backend: Predictions API functional
Frontend: Homepage loads with all required components
Frontend: Dark theme active by default
Frontend: Login page loads with email/password form and Google sign-in
Frontend: Register page loads with complete registration form and Google sign-up
Frontend: Theme toggle functionality working
Frontend: Search functionality working (Arsenal search successful)
Frontend: Grid/List view toggle present and functional
Frontend: WebSocket connection active (Live updates active indicator)
Frontend: Tab switching works (Popular, Top Live, Soon, Ended)
Frontend: League filters present (UCL, Premier League, etc.)
Frontend: 122+ match cards displaying properly
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Authentication state persistence issue - user sessions not maintained in frontend after successful registration/OAuth callback. Users can register and set nicknames successfully, but authentication state is lost causing protected routes to be inaccessible. This is likely an issue with session cookie handling or AuthContext state management.
